Title.evidence: NEPAFOX: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Perioperative FOLFIRINOX in Resectable Pancreatic Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: randomized patients with histologically confirmed resectable or borderline resectable pancreatic adenocarcinoma

Participants.evidence: patients with histologically confirmed resectable or borderline resectable pancreatic adenocarcinoma, without metastases

Intervention.evidence: upfront surgery followed by adjuvant gemcitabine (arm A) or perioperative FOLFIRINOX (arm B)

Objective.evidence: The NEPAFOX trial aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of perioperative FOLFIRINOX compared to standard adjuvant gemcitabine

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was overall survival (OS)

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was conducted using an interactive web response system with permuted blocks, stratified by ECOG performance status and resectability

Number_Randomised.evidence: 40 patients were randomized (arm A: 21, arm B: 19)

Result_Outcome.evidence: median OS was 25.68 months (95% CI 11.74, –) in arm A and 10.03 months (95% CI 6.25–27.95) in arm B

Harms.evidence: Adverse events grade ≥3 were higher in arm B (84% vs. 57%)

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered with ClinicalTrials.gov (NCT02172976)

Funding.evidence: The trial was funded by institutional sources
